description: Zepto's CEO Aadit Palicha defended the quick commerce sector against Union Minister Piyush Goyal's critique, emphasizing its economic contribution. Goyal urged startups to focus on high-tech fields. Ashneer Grover and TV Mohandas Pai also criticized the government's approach, highlighting the need for capital and investor support for deep-tech growth.
title: Tech entrepreneurs hit back at Goyal's remark on startups

description: A $5 trillion loss hit Wall Street as the S&P 500 dropped 6% after Donald Trump’s tariff hikes sparked fear of a global recession. China's retaliatory tariffs intensified market losses. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell warned of higher inflation and slower growth, while Trump remained defiant, labeling the economic turbulence as necessary for correcting trade imbalances.
title: Trump’s tariff war triggers $5tn wipeout as US markets suffer worst week since 2020

description: US buyers are demanding 15-20% discounts from Indian exporters due to increased tariffs. Large retailers remain steady, while smaller exporters face order delays. The clothing and gems sectors are particularly impacted, with higher tariffs causing uncertainty. Despite challenges, Indian suppliers remain key partners for global retailers adjusting their strategies.
title: Export orders on hold, US buyers seek 15-20% discount

description: PM Modi urged Bangladesh's chief adviser Muhammad Yunus to ensure the safety of minorities and investigate violence against them. Yunus called for a reality check on social media reports and emphasized non-interference. The meeting also discussed extradition issues, border security, and the potential for a free trade agreement.
title: PM Modi-Yunus meet: B’desh says reports of attacks on minorities ‘hugely inflated’

description: A new dispute has arisen over President Droupadi Murmu withholding assent to Tamil Nadu's bill for MBBS admissions based on Class XII marks instead of NEET scores. Chief Minister M K Stalin criticized this action, calling it authoritarian, and announced a meeting on April 9 to decide the next steps. He highlighted the bill's rejection despite state clarifications.
title: President has withheld nod to TN bill on NEET-based admissions: Stalin

description: The Rajya Sabha passed the Waqf (Amendment) Bill after a 15-hour debate, with 128 votes in favor and 95 against. The bill, already approved by the Lok Sabha, now awaits the President's assent. Minority affairs minister Kiren Rijiju defended the bill, asserting it involves both Muslims and non-Muslims.
title: RS passes waqf bill 128-95 as BJD boosts NDA numbers

description: The Supreme Court has ruled that public servants, including police officials, are protected from prosecution without prior government sanction, even when they exceed their official powers. This protection applies as long as there is a reasonable connection between the alleged wrongdoing and their official duties.
title: SC: Govt nod must to prosecute even officials accused of exceeding powers
Supreme Court hands Trump 2.0 first win, approves cuts to $600m DEI teacher grants

description: A tsunami warning was issued for Papua New Guinea after a 6.9-magnitude earthquake hit off New Britain Island. The quake occurred at a depth of 10 kilometers. Waves between one and three meters were expected, with potential for smaller waves in the Solomon Islands.
title: Tsunami warning issued after 6.9-magnitude earthquake strikes Papua New Guinea

description: Massive protests in Bokaro steel city over permanent jobs and a CISF lathicharge led to the death of a youth, causing significant disruption. The plant ceased production, with angry demonstrators blocking roads and setting vehicles ablaze, resulting in substantial financial losses and a tense standoff.
title: Bokaro Steel City shuts down over man’s death in lathicharge, production stopped

description: PM Narendra Modi emphasized the need for early restoration of democracy in Myanmar during a meeting with junta chief Senior General Min Aung Hlaing. Modi expressed condolences for the recent earthquake and discussed India's humanitarian efforts. Both leaders agreed on cooperation against insurgent activities and crimes along the India-Myanmar border.
title: India promises to support Myanmar towards switch to democratic future
Maha anganwadi worker, now 73, wins 14-yr battle for pension
Protests force Revanth govt to junk infotech park for eco park

description: The Supreme Court disapproved Jharkhand's decision to cut power for 10 hours during Ram Navami processions and instructed minimizing the outage to the barest minimum while maintaining essential services. The state cited past electrocution incidents as the reason for this precautionary measure.
title: Ram Navami: Jharkhand cuts power on rally route, draws SC's displeasure

description: The Supreme Court questioned the Delhi high court's order urging Wikimedia to remove a page criticizing judiciary proceedings. The bench stated such removal orders should only be issued if content is deemed contemptuous, not merely critical. Wikimedia opposed the HC order, emphasizing its importance for media freedom, referencing a defamation case by ANI. The page is already removed.
title: SC on Delhi HC ruling: Should courts be so touchy about criticism?

description: SC will examine the different arguments from Hindu and Muslim sides on the applicability of the Places of Worship Act, 1991 to the Mathura Shahi Idgah-Srikrishna Janmasthan dispute. Muslim side claims the suits violate the PoW Act, while Hindus argue it's protected under the ASI Act.
title: SC to examine if worship Act applies to Shahi Idgah

description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla rebuked Sonia Gandhi's claim that the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, 2025 was 'bulldozed' through Parliament, asserting rules were followed. Extensive debate and voting occurred. Protests ensued from Congress as government faced criticism over US tariffs on Indian goods, with Rahul Gandhi warning of severe economic impact and demanding action from PM Modi.
title: Birla chides Sonia for remarks on Waqf Bill, Cong says Parl is now Modi's durbar

description: Isro confirmed the successful re-entry of the PSLV Orbital Experimental Module (POEM-4) into Earth’s atmosphere, impacting the Indian Ocean on April 4, 2025. Launched as part of the SpaDeX mission, POEM-4 hosted 24 payloads and undertook key experiments, enhancing debris mitigation and sustainable space operations as part of the Debris Free Space Mission (DFSM).
title: Isro’s POEM-4, from SpaDeX mission, re-enters Earth’s atmosphere

description: Manjit Singh GK informed a Delhi court he received a pen drive with an alleged confession from Congress functionary Jagdish Tytler about his role in the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. The court heard details of Tytler boasting about influential connections and large sums misappropriated by acquaintances.
title: Tytler confessed to his role in killing of 100 Sikhs: Witness

description: With the Waqf Amendment Bill's passage, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's JD(U) faces potential backlash from the Muslim community, comprising 18% of the state's population. Despite internal dissent and past election losses, the party remains focused on promoting its minority welfare initiatives.
title: Waqf Bill: Poll-bound Bihar to be ‘test case’ for NDA

description: PM Narendra Modi commended the passage of the Waqf (Amendment) Bill and the Mussalman Wakf (Repeal) Bill by Parliament, highlighting their impact on transparency and socio-economic justice for marginalized Muslims. The legislation aims to eliminate corruption in waqf property management and benefit Muslim women and the underprivileged.
title: Watershed moment, says PM Modi of Waqf bill passage

description: Oil prices hit their lowest since mid-2021, influenced by China's tariff retaliation against the US and OPEC+'s decision to increase production. This decline offers India an opportunity to lower fuel prices, easing inflationary pressures and reducing import costs. Lower fuel costs could benefit the economy and households.
title: Window opens for fuel price cut as US-China tariff war trips oil prices

description: The Centre has downgraded Gursharan Kaur's security cover from Z-plus to Z, following a review of her threat perception. This change comes after the passing of former PM Manmohan Singh in 2024. CRPF will continue to provide protection, albeit with fewer personnel and a scaled-down protocol.
title: Centre downgrades security cover for ex-PM Manmohan Singh's wife

description: J&K's National Conference and Congress criticized LG Manoj Sinha for overstepping power boundaries with officer transfers, warning against further interference. A resolution condemned the Waqf Act. The coordination between the elected government and LG remains, but any future conflicts will be brought up in the assembly.
title: Don’t push us to the wall, Omar and allies tell LG over transfers

description: A Srinagar court ordered four men, guilty of drinking and causing public nuisance, to perform community service instead of imprisonment. The community service includes cleaning at a Sufi shrine and a government girls' higher secondary school. The court considers this a more humane and progressive approach to justice.
title: Drunken misconduct: Court orders community service for 4 convicts at Sufi shrine, school

description: Lucknow Super Giants secured a thrilling 12-run victory over Mumbai Indians in IPL 2025, thanks to young leg-spinner Digvesh Singh Rathi's critical spell of 1/21. Rathi's performance under pressure disrupted MI's chase and highlighted him as a rising star. Mitchell Marsh's 60 and Hardik Pandya's five-wicket haul were other key highlights in the match.
title: IPL 2025: Rathi's tight spell trumps Pandya as LSG down MI

description: Donald Trump responded to China's 34% retaliatory tariffs, causing US stocks to plunge. Despite his confidence in strong job numbers, American investors faced heavy losses. Trump hinted at possible negotiations despite earlier directives. He claimed other nations were willing to negotiate on tariffs. With US markets in turmoil, some US lawmakers challenge his approach.
title: Trump bravado as US market continues to tank after China retaliates
What are the benefits of Donald Trump's $5 million gold card? How to buy
‘Working hard on a deal’: Trump delays TikTok ban again, grants 75-day extension

description: The New York Yankees are awaiting the final decision on Cody Bellinger's availability for today's game against the Pittsburgh Pirates due to a recent hamstring strain. Bellinger has been undergoing light training, and a last-minute check-up will determine his participation.
title: Will Cody Bellinger play today against Pittsburgh Pirates? Latest update
Trump flashes Gold Card for rich foreign investors, says it will be ready in two weeks

description: The BJP in Tamil Nadu may be adjusting its political strategy, as state BJP president K Annamalai announced he is not contesting for re-election. This development follows Annamalai's controversial comments about late AIADMK leader Jayalalithaa and potential talks of reviving a BJP-AIADMK alliance ahead of the assembly elections.
title: Annamalai says not in race for TN chief post: Is BJP eyeing AIADMK tie-up?

description: Lucknow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Rathi made headlines again for his celebratory send-off after dismissing Mumbai Indians' Naman Dhir. Despite a prior fine for a similar action, Rathi repeated his aggressive celebration, leading to debate over potential further disciplinary action. With two send-offs in consecutive games, Rathi's behaviour may prompt sterner consequences from the league.
title: Digvesh Rathi courts controversy again with fiery send-off against MI
India Meteorological Department issues heatwave alert for Delhi till April 8

description: A Russian missile strike in Kryvyi Rig, Ukraine, killed 14 people and injured over 50, with the attack involving residential areas. President Zelenskyy stated that Russia seeks war and urged international pressure to end the conflict, emphasizing that the US, Europe, and global efforts are vital for peace.
title: Russia strikes Zelenskyy's hometown, kills 14

description: EU regulators are set to impose hefty penalties on Elon Musk's X platform for breaching the Digital Services Act, targeting illegal content and disinformation. A fine exceeding $1 billion is speculated, aiming to deter non-compliance by other companies. The investigation highlights X's inadequate content moderation, contributing to the spread of harmful content in the EU.
title: Europe may fine Elon Musk's X more than $1 billion

description: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya made history by becoming the first IPL captain to take a five-wicket haul. He took 5 wickets for 36 runs against Lucknow Super Giants. Pandya's spell was crucial in restricting LSG to a total of 203/8. This achievement is the best T20 performance of his career.
title: Hardik Pandya creates history, becomes first IPL captain to take a fifer

description: Rohit Sharma missed the crucial IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a knee injury sustained during practice. The incident raised concerns after visuals of him struggling surfaced online. MI shifted their strategy under Hardik Pandya's captaincy, who achieved a remarkable five-wicket haul amidst the swirling questions on Rohit's fitness.
title: Rohit Sharma's knee injury raises concerns as viral video sparks worry

description: When the world’s richest man finds himself out of juice, out of favour, and out of Wisconsin.
title: Tariffs to Tesla: Why Musk lost bigly this week

description: US President Donald Trump has announced reciprocal tariff on all foreign goods starting April 2025. This move could potentially shake up global trade dynamics. However, experts suggest India may experience minimal impact.
title: Trump's tariffs cause global shockwaves, but India may be among least vulnerable

description: Global stock markets plummeted after China retaliated against the US with significant new tariffs, heightening fears of a global recession. The S&P 500 experienced its worst drop since 2020, while the Dow and Nasdaq also saw significant declines. Heavy losses were seen across US companies with significant exposure to China.
title: US markets tumble, Trump says 'some pain' is worth it
5.0 magnitude quake hits Nepal, tremors felt in north India

description: US President Donald Trump criticized China's decision to impose a 34% tariff on all US imports, claiming China 'panicked' in response to his recent trade measures. China's finance ministry confirmed the tariffs as reciprocal. The tensions include higher tariffs on imports from the European Union, Japan, and Israel, with Trump declaring a national emergency to enforce his policy.
title: 'China played it wrong, panicked': Trump on Beijing's retaliatory tariff

description: Prime Minister Modi is visiting Sri Lanka to enhance defence ties and cooperation in energy, trade, and connectivity. The visit marks his first engagement with Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayaka. China's growing influence in the Indian Ocean region has heightened the significance of closer India-Sri Lanka relations.
title: China shift: Why PM Modi's Sri Lanka trip is crucial

description: The US economy exceeded job growth expectations in March, adding 228,000 jobs, largely driven by private sector gains in retail, transportation, and construction. The increase in full-time workers and rising nominal hourly wages signal economic strength, though analysts warn of potential impacts from Trump's tariffs.
title: 'Job, jobs, jobs': Trump's admin hails 'explosive' growth

description: Lucknow Super Giants' captain Rishabh Pant continued to struggle in IPL 2025, scoring just 2 runs against Mumbai Indians. This marks his third single-digit score in four games. Despite a strong start by openers Mitchell Marsh and Aiden Markram, Pant was dismissed by Hardik Pandya, further frustrating fans and team owner Sanjeev Goenka.
title: Rishabh Pant's horror run continues with another cheap dismissal - Watch

description: China has expanded its export restrictions on critical minerals in retaliation to US tariffs. Key materials like rare earth elements now have tighter controls, impacting high-tech industries and defence sectors globally. The move is aimed at leveraging China's dominance in the global mineral supply chain.
title: Tariff war: China targets US defence sector, curbs mineral export

description: Wall Street's 'fear gauge' surged to eight-month high as US stocks plummeted following China's new tariffs on all US goods, escalating trade tensions after Trump's tariff announcement. Global markets suffered significant losses, with European and Asian indices dropping sharply. The market turmoil raised fears of a recession, despite strong US hiring numbers.
title: Wall Street plunge pushes ‘fear gauge’ to 8-month high
‘17 hours, zero disruptions’: Rijiju hails record RS debate on Waqf Bill

description: Golden State Warriors' Stephen Curry will play in the crucial game against the Denver Nuggets, following his impressive performance against the LA Lakers. While Curry is fit, Gary Payton II remains out. With Denver facing multiple injuries, including a questionable Nikola Jokic, tonight's game could shift in favor of the Warriors.
title: Golden State Warriors final injury report: Stephen Curry play tonight?

description: Mumbai Indians captain Hardik Pandya provided an update on Jasprit Bumrah, who is undergoing rehabilitation and is expected to return soon. Rohit Sharma missed the IPL 2025 match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a knee injury. Hardik opted to bowl first after winning the toss. Key players from both teams featured in the playing XI.
title: Hardik Pandya breaks silence on Jasprit Bumrah: 'He should be ...'

description: Canadian police have released images of two suspects involved in vandalizing the Sri Krishna Brundavana Temple. The suspects damaged the temple's sign in the early hours of March 30. Security footage showed them desecrating the sign and shouting offensive remarks, including 'F****** terrorists.'
title: Hindu temple vandalised in Canada, police release photo of two suspects

description: On April 2, 2025, Donald Trump announced sweeping "reciprocal tariffs" on over 60 countries, triggering a wave of Star Wars: The Phantom Menace memes that turned satire into prophecy. Internet users invoked Trade Federation blockades, Queen Amidala’s warnings, and Palpatine’s power grabs to make sense of Trump’s tariff regime, which bypasses Congress via executive authority. The film, once mocked for its political themes, now feels eerily prescient. As global trade convulses and Walmart prices rise, memes have become both coping mechanism and analysis. In a world of penguin tariffs and populist economics, maybe George Lucas was right all along.
title: How Star Wars predicted Trump's trade wars

description: Mumbai Indians star opener Rohit Sharma has been ruled out of a crucial match against Lucknow Super Giants due to a knee injury. With MI struggling in the season, Hardik Pandya has focused on adaptation and execution. The team hopes Rohit's injury is minor and not indicative of a prolonged absence.
title: IPL 2025: Why Rohit Sharma not playing against LSG
Marathon sittings, historic bills: Budget Session in numbers
Taj Mahal brings in Rs 297 crore in 5 years, tops ASI monument earnings: Govt data

description: Though ageing can't be stopped, it might be possible to slow it down.  Vitamin D, with this nutrient and regular strength training each support healthy ageing in different ways—and together, they could help the body stay younger for longer. While more research is on the way, these findings are a reminder that small, everyday choices can have lasting impacts on health.
title: Vitamin D, combined with this nutrient slows ageing and helps live longer
‘Which Cong-ruled state gave funds to Waqf Board?’: JD(U) leader defends party amid resignations

description: A dangerous superbug resistant to antibiotics has been spreading in Malaysia. The bug, Acinetobacter baumannii, causes severe infections, particularly in hospitals. Researchers are concerned about its global impact due to its prevalence and resistance to multiple drugs. Continuous surveillance and improved treatments are urgently needed to combat this health threat.
title: Antibiotic-resistant superbug spreading in Malaysia- A global threat?
Billionaires lose $208 billion as Trump’s tariffs shake global markets

description: Tamil Nadu's Chief Minister MK Stalin declared the Centre's rejection of the state's Bill seeking NEET exemption a 'dark chapter in federalism.' The Bill, which aimed to base medical admissions on Class 12 marks, was rejected despite the state's clarifications. An all-party meeting is planned to decide the next steps.
title: 'Dark chapter in federalism': Stalin slams Centre after anti-NEET Bill rejected

description: To maximize benefits from PPF investments, ensure deposits are made by April 5 each year, as interest calculation is based on the minimum balance between the 5th and month's end. A timely deposit enhances returns, with tardy contributions resulting in interest loss.
title: Deposit PPF money by April 5 to get this big benefit

description: Pakistan spinner Sajid Khan humorously remarked he would have been a gangster if not a cricketer. In an interview, he made the tongue-in-cheek comment, bringing laughter. Sajid, known for his off-spin, praised Babar Azam and Virat Kohli while showcasing his wit and lighter side, continuing to entertain both on and off the field.
title: 'Main gangster hota': Pak cricketer's comment leaves everyone in splits

description: CSK's batting coach Michael Hussey hints at a leadership change for their IPL match against Delhi Capitals, opening the possibility of MS Dhoni returning as captain if Ruturaj Gaikwad is unable to play due to injury. With Gaikwad's participation uncertain, there is speculation that a young wicketkeeper might also fill in.
title: MS Dhoni to return as Chennai Super Kings captain?

description: The Waqf Amendment Bill 2025 sparked large-scale protests across India, including Ahmedabad, Kolkata, and Chennai, after it cleared Parliament. Leaders of AIMIM and Congress challenged its constitutionality in the Supreme Court. The Opposition and several leaders criticized the Bill's passage and its potential impact on religious rights.
title: Protests & petitions: Multipronged oppn erupts against Waqf Bill

description: A rat named Ronin has set a new record by detecting over 100 landmines in Cambodia since August 2021, surpassing the previous record held by Magawa. Trained by Belgian organization APOPO, Ronin is part of the HeroRAT initiative. Cambodia remains heavily mined due to past conflicts, and Ronin's achievements highlight the importance of animal-assisted demining efforts.
title: A 'squeaky' feat: Rat breaks world record for detecting landmines

description: US President Donald Trump's new 54% tariffs on Chinese imports could disrupt sectors, notably technology. China’s export ban on key minerals impacts US manufacturing. AI leader DeepSeek suggests China can counter with a mix of tariffs, export controls, tighter inspections, currency adjustments, trade diversification, legal challenges, and boosting domestic consumption to mitigate the impact.
title: Are Trump's reciprocal tariffs bad for China? DeepSeek says...

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi met Muhammad Yunus, chief adviser of Bangladesh's interim government, at the Bimstec Summit in Bangkok. Modi raised concerns over minority safety in Bangladesh and urged a thorough investigation of related incidents. He highlighted the significance of regional peace and constructive bilateral relations.
title: 'Avoid rhetoric that vitiates environment': PM Modi tells Yunus

description: Manchester City’s Kevin De Bruyne announced he will leave at the end of this season, ending his 10-year tenure. The 33-year-old, who joined in 2015, has won 14 major trophies, including six Premier League titles and the 2023 UEFA Champions League. De Bruyne expressed gratitude and cherished the memories with the club.
title: 'Let's enjoy last moments together!': De Bruyne confirms Man City exit

description: The PSEB Class 8 Result 2025 was announced on April 4, 2025. Students can check their results on pseb.ac.in. To access their mark sheets, they must enter their roll number and name. Original mark sheets will be distributed through schools. Exams took place from February 19 to March 7, 2025, with about 3 lakh students participating.
title: PSEB class 8 result out: Direct link, pass percentage and other details

description: Microsoft AI VP Nando de Freitas acknowledged Google's DeepMind for its new AI models while addressing restrictive employment contracts at DeepMind. He received multiple requests for help from distressed DeepMind employees regarding notice periods and noncompete agreements but directed them to internal leadership instead.
title: Microsoft VP tells Google employees: Don't come to me for jobs, go to….

description: Tamil Nadu BJP president K Annamalai stated on Friday that the party's leader would be chosen unanimously, and clarified that he is not a contender. This announcement follows speculation about a potential BJP-AIADMK alliance aimed at challenging the ruling DMK in the 2026 elections.
title: 'Not in race for TN BJP chief post': Annamalai sparks resignation rumours

description: Following LSG's eight-wicket loss to PBKS in the 2025 IPL, owner Sanjiv Goenka expressed strong faith in skipper Rishabh Pant's leadership. He emphasised Pant's instinct-driven style and potential for growth. Despite a tough game, Goenka encouraged the team to believe in themselves for future matches. LSG aims to bounce back against Mumbai Indians.
title: 'Rishabh Pant is yet to ... ': Sanjiv Goenka's huge take on LSG skipper

description: Mumbai Indians batting coach Kieron Pollard has backed Rohit Sharma, urging patience despite his slow start in IPL 2025. Pollard highlighted Rohit's legendary status and recent Champions Trophy success, encouraging fans to give him space. With important matches ahead, all eyes are on Rohit to reclaim his form and lead Mumbai Indians to success.
title: 'Rohit Sharma has earned the right not to be pressurised'

description: Ajinkya Rahane disciplined Yashasvi Jaiswal during the 2022 Duleep Trophy final, sending him off the field for aggressive sledging. The resurfaced video coincides with Jaiswal’s switch from Mumbai to Goa for the 2025–26 season. Jaiswal’s move is seen as a major boost for Goa, highlighting his fiery ambition and Rahane’s influence on his discipline.
title: Video of Rahane punishing Jaiswal for 'discipline issues' goes viral
Waqf war reaches SC: Congress MP moves court challenging Bill

description: A surprise heatwave hit Central Asia in March, a new study published Friday showed, putting in danger crops and water supply in a largely rural region already heavily affected by the impacts of climate change.  "Hotter March temperatures are impacting agriculture harvests and access to water in Central Asia, as well as people's health," said Friederike Otto, co-head of World Weather Attribution.
title: Crops under threat as surprise March heatwave hit Central Asia: Study

description: The Ministry of External Affairs has expressed serious concerns over the increasing incidents of anti-India graffiti defacing Hindu temples in the US. Diplomatic channels are actively addressing these hate crimes, with US authorities investigating and treating them as severe offenses. Members of US Congress have also advocated for broader strategies to counteract these hate crimes against Hindus.
title: Incidents of temples being defaced on rise in US: MEA

description: Gujarat Titans head coach Ashish Nehra stresses the importance of stability and simplicity in coaching. He aims to create a relaxed environment for players. Nehra supports captain Shubman Gill and believes in his potential to lead the team. He highlights the need for chemistry in frequently changing squads, focusing on the basics and personal growth.
title: 'No rocket science': Ashish Nehra reveals his coaching philosophy at GT

description: In Kolkata and Ahmedabad, protesters rallied against the Waqf Amendment Bill after Friday prayers, blocking roads and voicing their opposition. The bill, passed in the Rajya Sabha, makes changes such as reducing mandatory contributions and introducing state auditors. It awaits the President's nod to become law. Supporters claim it improves transparency, while critics see it as impinging on religious autonomy.
title: Protests erupt in Kolkata, Ahmedabad after passage of Waqf Bill

description: Punjab police constable Amandeep Kaur was dismissed for violating professional norms by posting social media videos in uniform and was subsequently arrested for possessing heroin. The action came amid a state anti-drug campaign, with police finding 17.71 grams of heroin during a search of her vehicle.
title: Punjabi songs, luxury bags and a Thar: How cop mocked own force in reels

description: Salman Khan's film 'Sikandar' had a lower-than-expected opening, earning Rs 26 crore on its first day. Despite releasing prior to Eid, it failed to show significant growth, collecting Rs 29 crore on Eid. By day 6, the film's total stood at Rs 90.66 crore, below expectations for a Salman Khan starrer.
title: Salman Khan starrer 'Sikandar' less likely to cross Rs 100 crore
Sheikh Hasina's extradition raised during PM Modi, Yunus talks: MEA

description: In an unexpected move, President Trump imposed a 10% tariff on US trading partners, amusingly including the uninhabited Heard and McDonald Islands of Australia. This decision sparked online satire and drew a mixed reply from Australia, with the tariffs affecting other territories like Norfolk Island more severely.
title: Social media has a field day over Trump’s tariff on uninhabited island

description: Economic forecasts show growing recession fears as Donald Trump's new tariff announcements dampen global business sentiment and disrupt supply chains. Major financial institutions like JPMorgan and Goldman Sachs have significantly increased the likelihood of a recession, while the S&P 500 has experienced severe market losses.
title: ‘There will be blood’: Is the world staring at a recession?

description: Not one or two but at least five leaders submitted their resignations as the bill was passed, first in Lok Sabha and then the Rajya Sabha on Thursday and Friday, respectively.  ​The latest to resign from the party was Nadeem Akhtar, his resignation follows that of four other leaders, including JD(U) leader Raju Nayyar, Tabrez Siddiqui Alig, Mohammad Shahnawaz Malik, and Mohammed Kasim Ansari.
title: Waqf Bill sparks rift within JD(U) as fifth leader quits party
Why Trump’s 1987 interview is going viral amid tariff move

description: Aadit Palicha, co-founder of Zepto, defended the contributions of consumer internet startups in response to Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal's remarks. Palicha highlighted Zepto's creation of 1.5 lakh jobs, significant tax contributions, and investments in backend supply chains, while acknowledging the need for more foundational technological advancements in India.
title: Zepto CEO replies to 'happy being delivery boys and girls': ‘still far away from…’
Key events that led to Yoon's removal as South Korea's President

description: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister M.K. Stalin announced that the Centre has rejected the state's Assembly resolution seeking NEET exemption. Despite submitting all necessary clarifications, the Union government declined the request. Stalin condemned the decision and scheduled an all-party meeting for April 9 to discuss future actions, describing it as a setback for federalism.
title: Setback for Tamil Nadu as Centre declines consent for anti-NEET bill

description: US President Donald Trump’s announcement of reciprocal tariffs revealed discrepancies between the displayed charts and the White House annexure. The White House has now amended the annex to match the lower rates initially shown. The revised rates will impact numerous countries with differential tariffs being applied from April 5.
title: Trump admin revises reciprocal tariffs for 14 countries including India - Full list
Bangladesh's Yunus presents throwback picture to PM Modi at bilateral meet

description: Vinay Somaiah, a 35-year-old BJP functionary, was found hanging in his office in Bengaluru. Before his death, Vinay had accused a Congress functionary of abetting his suicide following an arrest and FIR against him for comments made on a WhatsApp group.
title: BJP functionary found dead, blames Congress MLA in social media post

description: Jos Buttler, former England captain, shared his experiences with the Gujarat Titans and his career evolution. He discussed batting order roles, the use of data in cricket, and influence of other sports. Buttler hopes to continue playing international cricket despite stepping down as captain after England's recent disappointing ICC event results.
title: Exclusive: 'Cricket flooded with numbers, at times too much' - Buttler

description: Apple faces a tough decision as new tariffs by President Trump could increase iPhone prices by up to 43%. Without exemptions, Apple may absorb or pass on these costs, potentially raising the iPhone 16 Pro Max to $2,300. Analysts suggest Apple may only transfer a fraction of the costs to consumers, impacting their bottom line.
title: iPhones may start at Rs 99,000 post-Trump tariffs: 3 factors to watch

description: KKR's Venkatesh Iyer addresses the question on whether being the team's costliest player at Rs 23.75 crore leads to pressure, asserting that the focus is on team's performance instead of individual scores. After modest show in the first two matches of the season, his impactful 60-run knock led to an 80-run victory against Sunrisers Hyderabad.
title: KKR's Iyer smiles at question on price-tag pressure

description: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla criticised Sonia Gandhi's comments on the Waqf Amendment Bill, calling them "unfortunate" and undermining parliamentary democracy. Despite extensive discussions and proper procedures, Birla noted her allegations were inappropriate. Sonia Gandhi claimed the bill undermined democratic values and was pushed through forcibly, sparking debate between the government and opposition.
title: 'Unfortunate': LS Speaker Birla slams Sonia over Waqf Bill 'bulldozed' remark

description: US President Donald Trump has announced significant tariffs on trade partners to address trade imbalances. Conflicting accounts regarding the formula's origin add to the confusion, but it’s attributed to the Council of Economic Advisers and the US Trade Representative. The move raises concerns of a potential trade war.
title: Who developed Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff formula? Mystery continues

description: South Korea’s Constitutional Court upheld President Yoon Suk Yeol's impeachment, officially removing him from office for declaring martial law. The court found Yoon's actions violated the constitution. His removal ignited strong reactions and sets the stage for fresh elections amid ongoing political tensions.
title: 'I am truly sorry': South Korea's Yoon after being removed from office

description: White House has revised downward to 26% the reciprocal tariff on India from an initially published 27%. Several countries experienced their rates varying slightly before final rates were confirmed.
title: Is it 26% or 27%? Trump’s reciprocal tariffs on India revised downward

description: Myanmar's junta leader Min Aung Hlaing faces protests at a regional summit in Bangkok, as his country reels from a deadly 7.7-magnitude earthquake. Despite international aid efforts, the military's response remains lacking, with survivors struggling for basic necessities amid ongoing military offensives.
title: 'Murderer': Protests erupt in Bangkok as Myanmar junta chief attends summit

description: Supreme Court upholds the ban on the sale and manufacture of firecrackers, including green ones, in the National Capital Region, citing the right to health under Article 21. The court noted that the impact of air pollution is severe on the common man, particularly those who can't afford air purifiers.
title: 'Not everyone can afford air purifier': Why SC upheld cracker ban in NCR
PM Modi meets Bangladesh's Yunus, first since Sheikh Hasina's ouster

description: Indian stock market indices, BSE Sensex and Nifty50, suffered significant declines on Friday, triggered by US recession fears and new tariffs announced by American President Donald Trump.
title: Why is stock market crashing today? 4 factors

description: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh announced the party's intent to challenge the constitutionality of the Waqf (Amendment) Bill in the Supreme Court following its passage in both houses of Parliament. The bill faced opposition from several parties, while Prime Minister Modi lauded it as a move towards transparency and socio-economic justice, especially benefiting marginalized Muslim communities.
title: 'Will resist assaults of Modi govt': Cong to challenge Waqf Bill in SC

description: Wall Street experienced its largest one-day loss since the start of Covid due to new US tariffs announced by President Trump. The S&P 500 lost $2.4 trillion in value, with significant declines in tech and retail sectors. Analysts predict increases in household costs and an escalating trade conflict.
title: $2.4tn shock: How US stocks 'boomed' after Trump tariff surgery- 10 big numbers

description: The Enforcement Directorate searched locations linked to Kerala-based businessman Gokulam Gopalan for alleged foreign exchange violations. The investigation, under FEMA, includes Chennai and Kochi premises. Gopalan is involved in producing the film "L2: Empuraan", which has faced criticism and received an apology from actor Mohanlal for controversial content.
title: ED searches premises of 'Empuraan' producer over foreign exchange violations

description: Researchers at the University of Bristol have discovered that mammals began adapting to terrestrial lifestyles millions of years prior to the dinosaur-extinguishing asteroid impact. The study utilized limb bone fossils to reveal that ecological changes in the late Cretaceous spurred this evolutionary shift, particularly due to the emergence of flowering plants.
title: Mammals adapted to land just before dinosaurs-killing asteroid: Study

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended the sixth Bimstec Summit in Bangkok, where he discussed key areas of cooperation with Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra. Modi also attended cultural events, highlighting the shared cultural ties between India and Thailand, including a performance of the Thai Ramayana.
title: Watch: PM Modi shares highlights from 'action-packed' first day in Thailand
265 Mumbai-bound flyers still stuck in Turkey for more than 35 hours

description: Stock market today: BSE Sensex and Nifty50, the Indian equity benchmark indices, tanked in trade on Friday on global cues following US President Donald Trump’s reciprocal tariffs announcement.
title: BSE Sensex tanks over 700 points; Nifty50 below 23,000

description: Lucknow Super Giants and Mumbai Indians face off in a crucial game at the Ekana Stadium with Rishabh Pant and Rohit Sharma under scrutiny for their poor form. LSG seek to regain momentum, while MI aim to capitalize after their win over KKR.
title: LSG vs MI: Struggling Rohit, Pant face the music

description: Eight villagers suffocated to death in a well in Khandwa, MP, while attempting to rescue one another after one person fell in. Toxic gases from contamination in the well are suspected to have caused the deaths. The well, used only for idol immersions, turned deadly due to accumulated muck. Each victim's family will receive Rs 4 lakh in compensation.
title: MP youth falls into well, 7 jump one by one to save him, all die

description: Union Minister Piyush Goyal highlighted the disparity between Indian and Chinese startups, emphasizing that while Indian startups focus on food delivery and fantasy sports apps, Chinese startups concentrate on advanced technologies like EVs, AI, and semiconductors. He called for more domestic investment and innovation in the Indian startup ecosystem.
title: We have food apps, China has AI, EV: Piyush Goyal's startup reality check

description: Two individuals from JD(U) in Bihar resigned over disagreements with the party's support for the Waqf (Amendment) Bill, which they claim is against Indian Muslims. JD(U) states these individuals are not part of the official party structure. Senior leaders express concerns but not direct opposition.
title: 'Belief shattered': Two JD(U) leaders resign over party's support for Waqf bill

description: Brady Tkachuk's rise to NHL stardom has been influenced by his notable hockey lineage. While his talent is undeniable, his famous last name likely opened early career opportunities. Critics question whether he would have achieved the same success without his family's legacy.
title: Nepotism in the NHL: Would Brady Tkachuk be a star if his last name wasn’t Tkachuk?
'Took actions beyond powers': South Korea's President removed from office

description: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research recommends buying NHPC and Symphony stocks amidst positive market signals. Nifty and Bank Nifty are expected to see upward movements.
title: Top stocks to buy today: Stock recommendations for April 4, 2025
US markets tumble: Trump’s new tariffs spark biggest Dow wipeout since 2020

description: Renowned actor and filmmaker Manoj Kumar, popularly known as 'Bharat Kumar,' passed away at 87 after a prolonged illness. Known for his patriotic films like Shaheed, Upkar, and Roti Kapda Aur Makaan, Kumar left a significant impact on Indian cinema. Fellow filmmaker Ashoke Pandit confirmed the news, expressing that the industry will greatly miss him.
title: Veteran actor-director Manoj Kumar, known as Bharat Kumar, bids farewell at 87

description: A man set himself and his car on fire at Amsterdam's Dam Square in a suspected suicide attempt. The incident, which began with a small explosion, resulted in no bystander injuries. The driver, a 50-year-old Dutch citizen, was hospitalized under police custody. Police and explosives experts investigated the scene.
title: Watch: Car erupts in flames at Amsterdam’s Dam Square, suicide attempt suspected
Watch: Donald Trump flaunts $5 million 'Gold Card' — what it looks like
'Watershed moment': PM Modi hails Waqf Bill passage in Parliament

description: Saquon Barkley, Philadelphia Eagles running back, gave a signed football to Ivanka Trump's son at the J.P. Morgan Tech 100 Summit. This act garnered mixed reactions online. Despite the social media speculation, Barkley has maintained focus on football. He aims to continue shining on the field, coming off a historic season where he surpassed 2,000 rushing yards.
title: Saquon Barkley surprises Trump’s daughter Ivanka & grandson with signed football
'Going to boom': Trump reacts to worst stock market crash in yrs following tariffs

description: Macquarie Equity Research rated Vodafone India 'underperform' with a target price of Rs 6.50. Elara Securities India maintained an 'accumulate' stance on Hindalco Industries, while Emkay Global Financial Services downgraded Dabur to 'reduce'. JM Financial and Nirmal Bang Securities recommended 'buy' for Inox India and Sky Gold & Diamonds respectively.
title: Buy or sell: Stock recommendation by brokers for April 4, 2025

description: Supporters of former Nepali king Gyanendra Shah have raised Rs 4.8 lakh to help pay a penalty for damage during a pro-monarchy protest. The government had imposed an Rs 8 lakh fine for damage to public property. Meanwhile, Shah denied involvement in the unrest and criticized the government for its failures.
title: Sacked Nepal official crowdfunds to pay fine imposed on Gyanendra

description: Salman Khan's action drama Sikandar struggles at the domestic box office with only Rs 5.75 crore on Day 5, total earnings reaching Rs 90 crore. Producers claim global earnings of Rs 158.5 crore. Audience turnout remains low at 8.24% occupancy. The film risks becoming one of Khan’s lower-grossing efforts, crucial days ahead for potential recovery.
title: Sikandar box office collection Day 5: Salman Khan starrer CRASHES with just Rs 5.75 crore earning on Thursday

description: An assistant teacher at a private school in Akola was arrested for molesting 10 girl students while their female teachers were away. The incident was reported to the school authorities by the aggrieved parents, leading to immediate police action and the involvement of the Child Helpline.
title: Private school staffer molests 10 girls in Maharashtra

description: American universities are experiencing a noticeable decline in the mathematical proficiency of incoming students, as highlighted by MIT and Harvard professors. This decline has led to the introduction of remedial math courses at prestigious institutions. One proposed solution is to improve the quality and availability of math teachers in schools.
title: Stripe CEO says top US universities have a 'math problem'; Elon Musk responds

description: US President Trump's tariff hikes could potentially boost India's share in global smartphone production from Apple and Samsung. Apple's expansion in India appears more attractive as it seeks lower tariffs through negotiations. Meanwhile, Samsung may scale up operations in India due to increased tariffs on its Vietnam base.
title: It's advantage India in smartphone manufacturing

description: The recent imposition of a 27% tariff on Indian gems and jewellery imports by the US is likely to significantly reduce demand in its largest export market, causing potential job cuts in the heavily manual labor-dependent industry. Exporters anticipate that without favorable trade negotiations, there could be a 30-50% decline in US exports.
title: Tariff tussle: Jewellers stare at low US demand, job losses

description: Metal exporters in India are relieved as the White House exempts steel and aluminium from an additional 27% duty, though a 25% tariff remains. Copper is also spared from reciprocal tariffs. Experts note that major issues may arise from secondary effects if a tariff conflict ensues, but the proposed 12% safeguard duty could protect India's steel sector.
title: Trump tariff: Steel, aluminium untouched; metal exporters breathe easy

description: Mike Waltz faces criticism for using Gmail for official duties, with concerns raised about the management of sensitive communications in Trump's administration. Waltz admitted to using Gmail but stated no classified material was sent. This follows a recent blunder involving a Signal group chat discussing Yemen airstrikes that was accidentally shared with a journalist.
title: Google's Gmail becomes 'new headache' for Trump's National Security Advisor
